meanings.definition: To turn to for aid or relief
meanings.sent1: When feeling lost, she found herself resorting to her trusted friend for help.
meanings.sent2: During tough times, people often resort to seeking comfort in familiar places.
meanings.sent3: The cat, resorting to meowing loudly, finally got the attention it wanted.
meanings.sent4: As the storm raged on, the ship resorted to changing its course to avoid danger.
meanings.sent5: In the face of danger, the hero resorted to using his wit to outsmart the villain.

meanings.definition: To go, especially frequently or customarily
meanings.sent1: Every morning, he resorts to jogging in the park to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: The students resort to studying hard before their exams to achieve good grades.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel resorts to climbing the tree to escape from the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: As a creature of habit, she resorts to taking the same route to work every day.
meanings.sent5: In times of stress, some people resort to eating comfort food for solace.

meanings.definition: A place frequented for holidays or recreation
meanings.sent1: The beach resorting to families for summer vacations was always fully booked.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, the mountain resorting to skiers became bustling with activity.
meanings.sent3: The amusement park, resorting to colorful decorations, attracted many visitors.
meanings.sent4: The island resorting to crystal-clear waters was a paradise for snorkelers.
meanings.sent5: The lakeside resorting to peaceful surroundings was the perfect retreat for city dwellers.
